intro: Forsythia × intermedia var. vitellina, commonly known as the golden trumpet bush, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that appear in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and hedges. Its rapid growth and long-lasting blooms make it a valuable addition to ornamental landscapes.
